intro: Meconopsis tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan poppy, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as Papaver and Eschscholzia. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often cultivated in alpine gardens and botanical collections.
